citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Two pregnant female French Bulldogs (Georgette, m/c #941000023150873 and Wilhelmina, m/c #941000022078299),
were very thin on inspection. Both dogs have prominently visible lumbar vertebrae, visible ribs with slight fat cover on
palpation, and pelvic bones that are easy to appreciate when standing. An abdominal tuck is present on both dogs,
though less obvious on Georgette due to her being heavily bred. Both are routinely dewormed according to a schedule
developed by the AV and currently being fed an adult maintenance diet. Pregnant and nursing females have increased
nutritional requirements due to the additional demands on the body during pregnancy and lactation, and a poor body
condition could negatively affect both the dam and the puppies. The licensee did not consult the attending veterinarian
prior to inspection. The licensee must consult the attending veterinarian on developing an adequate feeding regimen for
pregnant and nursing females to maintain a healthy body condition in those animals.
To be corrected by: 12.9.25

At time of inspection a male Schnauzer (Otto) was not identified. Identification aids in record keeping and animal
management. The licensee must identify the dog by an approved method, microchip, tattoo or official tag.
To be corrected by: 12.11.25

At time of inspection an adult male Schnauzer, Otto (no ID), was exhibiting some pendulous matting on his mid back and
both hind legs. Matted hair can be painful and cause health issues if left unattended. The licensee must follow the
program of veterinary care, which has been developed and approved by the attending veterinarian, to ensure appropriate
grooming practices.
To be corrected by: 12.11.25
This inspection and initial exit interview were conducted with facility representative on December 4, 2025.
Additional Inspectors:
Lindsay Livingston, Veterinary Medical Officer n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Two pregnant female French Bulldogs (Georgette, m/c #941000023150873 and Wilhelmina, m/c #941000022078299), 
were very thin on inspection. Both dogs have prominently visible lumbar vertebrae, visible ribs with slight fat cover on 
palpation, and pelvic bones that are easy to appreciate when standing. An abdominal tuck is present on both dogs, 
though less obvious on Georgette due to her being heavily bred. Both are routinely dewormed according to a schedule 
developed by the AV and currently being fed an adult maintenance diet. Pregnant and nursing females have increased 
nutritional requirements due to the additional demands on the body during pregnancy and lactation, and a poor body 
condition could negatively affect both the dam and the puppies. The licensee did not consult the attending veterinarian 
prior to inspection. The licensee must consult the attending veterinarian on developing an adequate feeding regimen for 
pregnant and nursing females to maintain a healthy body condition in those animals.  
 
To be corrected by: 12.9.25 
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
At time of inspection a male Schnauzer (Otto) was not identified. Identification aids in record keeping and animal 
management. The licensee must identify the dog by an approved method, microchip, tattoo or official tag. 
 
To be corrected by: 12.11.25 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
At time of inspection an adult male Schnauzer, Otto (no ID), was exhibiting some pendulous matting on his mid back and 
both hind legs. Matted hair can be painful and cause health issues if left unattended. The licensee must follow the 
program of veterinary care, which has been developed and approved by the attending veterinarian, to ensure appropriate 
grooming practices. 
 
To be corrected by: 12.11.25

This inspection and initial exit interview were conducted with facility representative on December 4, 2025. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Lindsay Livingston, Veterinary Medical Officer n
